name: fuggy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having air that is not pure, especially because of smoke, heat, or having a lot of people in a small space: Pubs have become a lot less fuggy since smoking was banned. The fuggy atmosphere seemed to stick in the lungs. See
fug
More examplesFewer examplesThey ate breakfast huddled in the fuggy confines of the tent. The room was fuggy and hot.The air was fuggy with burnt tobacco.
